user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of check_apply_params:
```c
static int
check_apply_params (void)
{
  if (tool_params.help)
  {
    show_help ();
    return -1;
  }
  else if (tool_params.version)
  {
    print_version ();
    return -1;
  }
  check_param_port ();
  check_apply_param__all_cpus ();
  check_apply_param__threads ();
  if (! check_apply_param__thread_per_conn ())
    return PERF_RPL_ERR_CODE_BAD_PARAM;
  if (! check_param__epoll ())
    return PERF_RPL_ERR_CODE_BAD_PARAM;
  if (! check_param__poll ())
    return PERF_RPL_ERR_CODE_BAD_PARAM;
  check_param__empty_tiny_medium_large ();
  check_param__shared_single_unique ();
  if (! check_param__connections ())
    return PERF_RPL_ERR_CODE_BAD_PARAM;
  return 0;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No code fragment in the provided function uses any compiler-specific language extensions. The function contains only standard C constructs: a static function definition, if/else statements, function calls, and return statements. There are no uses of known compiler extensions such as __attribute__ (or other __attribute__ forms), asm/inline assembly, typeof, __builtin_... functions, __extension__, GCC statement expressions ({ ... }), nested functions, labels-as-values (&&label), or other vendor-specific keywords or syntactic extensions. Identifier names with double underscores are implementation-reserved identifiers but are not language extensions per se; Rule 1.2 requires reporting explicit compiler language extensions as documented by the compiler, and none appear in this snippet.
